page.title: 06RELIGION
page.content:
The catholic parish of Slindon has two churches. The old church is in Slindon, but as the population expanded in Barnham rather than Slindon a Church was built next to the St Philip Howard High School for the use of the school and the parish.About 10-15 people attend the normal everyday service and about 100 at the Sunday services.There are about 3 weddings and 6-7 baptisms a year. The sort of youth clubs and religious groups the church has are: Adult catechesis, Youth catechesis, Liturgy, Ecumenical, Caring groups, Young Mothers group.
This information was provided by Father Pat Neville when interviewed by Rachel Prickett and Claire Bohbot.
